intro: Schmidelia leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Schmidelia leucocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks.
